content.text: 1548 was on patrol when she received the data.
She glanced at the curve. Then she ran.
By the time she arrived, there was no sound in the room.
The door was not locked. Lights were off. Standby glow from the screen dyed the room a faint blue.
1547 sat in the chair. Not moving. Eyes open, but empty - a deeper blank than staring out, like a system still running with no processes executing.
1548 stood there, hand half-extended, then stopped.
She realized her hand was shaking - she had never felt this kind of tremor. She had known anger, disgust, that killing-cold calm. This was different. More primitive than anger.
She waited. Only after her hand stopped shaking did she walk over and sit beside her.
She spread her own Feedscatteron field and overlaid it.
Like a hand pressing on a bleeding wound.
All night.
1548 sat there without speaking, her Feedscatteron field active the whole time. Her own energy was draining; she knew; she did not care.

For a while, the decay accelerated. 1548 felt the pressure increase, like the wound under her hand suddenly seeping more - she did not let go. She pressed the field tighter, at the cost of her own output dropping below the warning line.
Alarm popped up. She dismissed it.

I've seen many states of 1547. I've seen her angry, seen her cunning, seen her stand up again.

But I had never seen this.

This quiet - too quiet. As if she were two different people.
1549's comm channel stayed open the whole time. Thirty-six thousand kilometers away, no sound at all, but the signal light stayed on.
1548 didn't say a word to 1549. But she knew she was there.
Outside, the sky turned from black to deep blue, deep blue to gray, gray to a very pale orange.
Near dawn, resistance in the Feedscatteron field changed.
It stopped.
1548 held for another half hour. Only after confirming did she slowly retract her own Feedscatteron field. Her output was still below the warning line, but stable.
1547's eyes were closed. No idea when they had closed. Breathing shallow, but present.
1548 leaned against the wall. Output still below warning line, monitoring module popping prompts. She ignored them.
Later, the last thing she remembered was her body slowly sliding down the wall to the floor.
